SEARCH
Package com.app.validator

Interface Validator<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of object to be validated
All Known Implementing Classes:
ChangePasswordValidator, ClientDtoValidator, CreateUserDtoValidator, EmailDtoValidator, NewPasswordValidator, PasswordValidator
public interface Validator<T>
A generic interface for validating objects of type Validator. Implementations of this interface should define the validation logic for the specific type Validator.

  • Method Details

    • validate

      String validate(T t)
      Validates the given object of type Validator. The validation logic should be implemented by classes that implement this interface.
      Parameters:
      t - the object to validate
      Returns:
      a string containing the validation error message, or an empty string if validation passes

    • validate

      static <T> void validate(T t, Validator<T> validator)
      A utility method to validate an object using the provided Validator. If the validation fails (i.e., the error message is not empty), an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of object to be validated
      Parameters:
      t - the object to validate
      validator - the validator to use for validation
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails

    • stringNullCheck

      static boolean stringNullCheck(String s)
      Checks if a given string is null.
      Parameters:
      s - the string to check
      Returns:
      true if the string is null, false otherwise

    • stringMinLength

      static boolean stringMinLength(String s, int minLength)
      Checks if the length of a given string is less than the specified minimum length.
      Parameters:
      s - the string to check
      minLength - the minimum length
      Returns:
      true if the string's length is less than the minimum length, false otherwise

    • stringRegexCheck

      static boolean stringRegexCheck(String s, String regex)
      Checks if a given string matches the specified regular expression.
      Parameters:
      s - the string to check
      regex - the regular expression
      Returns:
      true if the string matches the regular expression, false otherwise
